pkgmetadata.longdescription: zi_api_auth_client==============================This library supports 2 types of authentication methods. Both the methods return a JWT token which you can use to makeapi calls for enterprise-api on production.Username and password authentication:============================================================**Usage:**1. import zi_api_auth_client2. jwt_token = zi_api_auth_client.user_name_pwd_authentication("your_user_name", "your_password")PKI authentication:==============================This type of authentication needs a private key and a client ID to generate the JWT token.**Usage:**1. import zi_api_auth_client2. Paste your private key: key = ''' -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----- Your private key goes here -----END PRIVATE KEY-----'''3. jwt_token = zi_api_auth_client.pki_authentication("your_user_name", "your_client_id", key)**Note: If you get the error "ValueError: Could not deserialize key data." when doing PKI authentication, make sure that your private key is properly formatted. Paste the private key as a multi-line string in python.****Correct way:**The following is the right way to paste your private key. ''' -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----- Your private key goes here -----END PRIVATE KEY-----'''**Wrong way:**Pasting the private key as follows would throw the error "ValueError: Could not deserialize key data." because there are extra spaces on each line in the key. ''' -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----- Your private key goes here -----END PRIVATE KEY-----'''
